common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Initialization and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces Desktop app initialization and account linking. Initialization problems often occur on Windows due to insufficient permissions during installation. Account linking issues involve difficulties linking multiple accounts, primarily Google and GitHub. Solutions include running the installer with admin rights, using WinGet for installation, and awaiting a new authentication service from Pieces.

Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Account Linking Issues with JohnKennyUK

**Key Points:**

* JohnKennyUK reported an issue with account linking between his Github and Google accounts.
* The current account linking system is not working as intended and the Pieces team is actively working on a replacement.
* Mark, a Pieces support staff member, offered to help JohnKennyUK manually connect his accounts.
* JohnKennyUK's accounts were temporarily connected, but a capitalization issue prevented a permanent fix.
* The Pieces team is switching to a new authentication service with better account linking capabilities.
* JohnKennyUK successfully linked his accounts using the new Auth app, but then accidentally linked them in the wrong order.
* JohnKennyUK is waiting for a reset to re-link his accounts correctly.

**Problems Identified:**

* The existing account linking system was not straightforward and caused issues for users.
* A capitalization issue in email addresses prevented seamless account linking.
* An accidental wrong-order linking with the new Auth app requires a reset.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark offered to manually merge JohnKennyUK's accounts.
* JohnKennyUK is waiting for the new authentication service with improved linking capabilities.
* Mark offered to help JohnKennyUK re-link his accounts after a reset.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* JohnKennyUK's accounts are currently linked but in the wrong order.
* He is waiting for a reset to re-link his accounts correctly.
* The new authentication service is under development and is expected to be released by mid-March.

**Additional Notes:**

* The capitalization issue is a known issue with the existing auth service and will be resolved with the new service.
* JohnKennyUK is one of the first users to try the new Auth app and his feedback will be valuable for the Pieces team.

**Overall, the Pieces team is committed to resolving account linking issues and improving the user experience.**

Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @SherlockSol reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.
* The issue was described as "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect".
* Another user @uzaxirr reported experiencing the same issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* The root cause of the issue was initially unclear.
* The Pieces team struggled to reproduce the issue.
* The .exe installer appeared not to request admin rights, leading to problems binding to a local port.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user @zedevmed suggested installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop app using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* This solution worked for the user and was confirmed to be related to the lack of admin rights during installation.
* The Pieces team acknowledged the solution and planned to adjust the installation process accordingly.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved for users who install Pieces using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* The Pieces team is working on updating the documentation to recommend the appropriate installation method.
* The team is also investigating the root cause of the issue and may implement additional fixes in the future.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user @SherlockSol provided log files and hardware information to assist with troubleshooting.
* The Pieces team attempted to schedule a call with the user for further investigation but the outcome is unclear.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of account linking issues:** The most frequent and active support tickets revolve around account linking problems in the Pieces Desktop app, particularly on Windows. Focus on resolving the root causes of these issues to reduce ticket volume.
**Improve installation instructions for Windows:** Guide users to install the Pieces Desktop app using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session to avoid permission errors during installation.

**Investigate and address the "Invalid Port" error:**  Despite a workaround, the root cause of the "Invalid Port" error on Windows remains unclear. Further investigation is needed to determine if it's related to antivirus software or other factors.

**Improve error messaging for OS login issues:** The HTTP 500 error for OS login on Linux doesn't provide users with actionable information. Improve error messages to help users troubleshoot or provide more context to the support team.

**Consider a dedicated troubleshooting guide for account linking:** Given the persistence of account linking issues, create a comprehensive guide that addresses common problems, solutions, and workarounds.
